newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens sells laser unit on NASDAQ.
newsitem.headline: Siemens sells laser unit on NASDAQ.

text.p: Laser maker Rofin-Sinar, formerly a wholly owned subsidiary of Siemens AG, listed its shares on New York's NASDAQ stock exchange on Wednesday, the two companies said on Thursday.
Ten million shares were issued at $9.50 a share. Siemens has no stake in the new company.

Rofin-Sinar's operations, which include affiliates in Germany, the U.S., Japan, France and Italy, will be consolidated under Rofin-Sinar Technologies Inc, a holding company with headquarters in Plymouth, Michigan.
Siemens sold the company as part of an effort to shed peripheral activities and concentrate on core businesses. Rofin-Sinar is the first such company Siemens has sold through a public offering.
Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Alex Brown and Lehman Brothers handled the sale.
